description: Check pseudo-label quality with K=4 samples per prompt using base model
question: Can the base model produce reliable consensus pseudo-labels?
interpretation: 38% overall accuracy is below 50% target. However, high-confidence examples (>=75% agreement) are 100% accurate, just rare (13%). This suggests the model CAN be right when confident, but K=4 doesn't produce enough confident examples.
next_step: Try K=8 to see if more samples produce more high-confidence examples and better overall accuracy
